card.back:
Uncover and discover a customer’s wants and needs by asking open-ended questions.

These questions start with who, what, when, where, why and how.

Either/or questions help you narrow down what a customer is looking for.

When you ask these questions, you typically give your customer two choices.

Closed questions are valuable for getting exact answers or for fact-finding. (For example, “Do you have insurance?”)

They help move a sale forward during the presentation / evaluate choices phase.

Find out and discover a customer’s wants and needs by not asking questions.

These questions start with not asking them.
